sources.title: Flight From Ashiya (1964) Yul Brynner Â· Richard Widmark
sources.description: Intended as a hymn to the selfless efforts of the men of the American air rescue service, the film combines the rescue of Japanese shipwrecked sailors with three pathetically drawn-out flashbacks..

metadata.Plot: Flight from Ashiya is a 1964 film about the U.S. Air Force's Air Rescue Service, flying out of Ashiya Air Base, Japan. In this fictionalized film set in the early 1960s, a flight crew's mission is to rescue a life raft of Japanese civilians stranded in rough seas. The Airplane used in the film was the HU-16 Albatross, A flying boat.
metadata.Actors: Yul Brynner, Richard Widmark, George Chakiris
